section1.para: We will record here any changes to this resource as a result of developments in the law or practice.

def.para: [FULL COMPANY NAME] incorporated and registered in England and Wales with company number [NUMBER] whose registered office is at [REGISTERED OFFICE ADDRESS]
[FULL COMPANY NAME] incorporated and registered in England and Wales with company number [NUMBER] whose registered office is at [REGISTERED OFFICE ADDRESS]
[INDIVIDUAL NAME] of [INDIVIDUAL ADDRESS]

clause.para: Describe key drafting assumptions in this clause.

section1.para:
For information on interpretation clauses generally, see
Interpretation: drafting note
.

clause.title: Interpretation
clause.para: The following definitions and rules of interpretation apply in this agreement.

def.para: definition text.
this example definition demonstrates that it is possible to:

subclause2.para: use subclause2 tags in definitions; and
follow them with other defined terms,

def.para: such asThis, which will occasionally be necessary.
a day other than a Saturday, Sunday or public holiday in England when banks in [London] are open for business.
the period from [0900 to 1700] on any Business Day.
[means [DATE] OR has the meaning given in [INSERT TERM CLAUSE NUMBER]].
has the meaning given in [INSERT CONFIDENTIALITY CLAUSE NUMBER].
the 12 month period following the Commencement Date and each succeeding 12 month period.
a period of 24 consecutive hours [ending at 12 midnight OR starting at [INSERT TIME]].
shall be as defined in section 1124 of the Corporation Tax Act 2010, and the expression change in control shall be construed accordingly.
has the meaning given in [INSERT FORCE MAJEURE CLAUSE NUMBER].

in relation to a company, that company, any subsidiary or holding company [from time to time OR at the date of this agreement] of that company[, and any subsidiary [from time to time OR at the date of this agreement] of a holding company of that company].
in relation to a company, any member of its Group.

holding company andsubsidiary: mean a "holding company" and "subsidiary" as defined in section 1159 of the Companies Act 2006 [and a company shall be treated, for the purposes only of the membership requirement contained in subsections 1159(1)(b) and (c), as a member of another company even if its shares in that other company are registered in the name of (a) another person (or its nominee), by way of security or in connection with the taking of security, or (b) its nominee]. In the case of a limited liability partnership which is a subsidiary of a company or another limited liability partnership, section 1159 of the Companies Act 2006 shall be amended so that: (a) references in sub sections 1159(1)(a) and (c) to voting rights are to the members' rights to vote on all or substantially all matters which are decided by a vote of the members of the limited liability partnership; and (b) the reference in section 1159(1)(b) to the right to appoint or remove a majority of its board of directors is to the right to appoint or remove members holding a majority of the voting rights.

all patents, rights to inventions, utility models, copyright and related rights, trade marks, service marks, trade, business and domain names, rights in trade dress or get-up, rights in goodwill or to sue for passing off, unfair competition rights, rights in designs, rights in computer software, database rights, semi-conductor topography rights, moral rights, rights in confidential information (including know-how and trade secrets) and any other intellectual property rights, in each case whether registered or unregistered and including all applications for and renewals or extensions of such rights, and all similar or equivalent rights or forms of protection in any part of the world. Intellectual Property Right means any one of the Intellectual Property Rights.

the London Inter-Bank Offered Rate, being the index compiled for the British Banker’s Association giving an average rate at which a leading bank can obtain unsecured funding for a given period in a given currency in the London market.
a calendar month.
value added tax chargeable under the Value Added Tax Act 1994.
any period of seven consecutive Days.
any period of 12 consecutive Months [from DATE][from 1 January to the following 31 December].

subclause1.para: Clause [, Schedule and paragraph] headings shall not affect the interpretation of this agreement.
A person includes a natural person, corporate or unincorporated body (whether or not having separate legal personality) [and that person's personal representatives, successors and permitted assigns].
[The Schedules form part of this agreement and shall have effect as if set out in full in the body of this agreement. Any reference to this agreement includes the Schedules.]
A reference to a company shall include any company, corporation or other body corporate, wherever and however incorporated or established.
Unless the context otherwise requires, words in the singular shall include the plural and in the plural shall include the singular.
Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference to one gender shall include a reference to the other genders.
A reference to any party shall include that party's personal representatives, successors and permitted assigns.
A reference to a statute or statutory provision is a reference to it as [amended, extended or re-enacted from time to time OR it is in force as at the date of this agreement].
A reference to a statute or statutory provision shall include all subordinate legislation made [from time to time OR as at the date of this agreement] under that statute or statutory provision.
A reference to writing or written includes faxes but not e-mail.
Any obligation on a party not to do something includes an obligation not to allow that thing to be done.
[References to a document in agreed form are to that document in the form agreed by the parties and initialled by or on behalf of them for identification.]

[Any reference to an English legal term for any action, remedy, method of judicial proceeding, legal document, legal status, court, official or any legal concept or thing shall, in respect of any jurisdiction other than England, be deemed to include a reference to that which most nearly approximates to the English legal term in that jurisdiction.]

[A reference to "this agreement" or to any other agreement or document referred to in this agreement is a reference to this agreement or such other document or agreement as varied or novated (in each case, other than in breach of the provisions of this agreement) from time to time.]
References to clauses [and Schedules] are to the clauses [and Schedules] of this agreement [and references to paragraphs are to paragraphs of the relevant Schedule].

[Where any statement is qualified by the expression so far as [PARTY] is aware or to [PARTY]'s knowledge (or any similar expression), that statement shall be deemed to include an additional statement that it has been made after due and careful enquiry.]

Any words following the termsincluding, include, in particular or any similar expression shall be construed as illustrative and shall not limit the sense of the words, description, definition, phrase or term preceding those terms.

This
clause 3
illustrates the different sub-clauses that can be used in a standard document, their layout and appropriate punctuation. This text may go to:

subclause2.para: that subclause2 can in turn go to:

subclause3.para: subclause3 level and stay at that level; or

subclause1.para: but avoid using subclause4 wherever possible.
Do not use bullet points.
Where terms are defined later in the agreement, put the defterm in brackets after the definition ( Like This).

clause.title: Optional and alternative words, phrases and clauses

subclause1.para: To indicate that a clause, schedule, part or paragraph of a schedule is optional, set the attribute for the clause, schedule, part or paragraph tooptional. The text will turn grey in Epic, and square brackets will appear around it on the web and in the Word version.
Indicate [optional] words by typing square brackets around them.
Indicate alternative words and phrases by typing "OR" between them and typing square brackets around that, for example, "[option one OR option two]".
[Indicate alternative paragraphs by providing for both, separated by " OR", as in this illustration.
The alternative paragraph.]
You might not want subclauses under all your clauses. If you only put one subclause within the clause tag, the subclause number won't show in Word or on the web - you'll only see it in Epic.

section1.para:
For more information on governing law and jurisdiction clauses, see
Governing law and jurisdiction: drafting note
.

subclause1.para: This [agreement OR deed] and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the law of England and Wales.

The parties irrevocably agree that the courts of England and Wales shall have [exclusive OR non-exclusive] jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim that arises out of or in connection with this [agreement OR deed] or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims).
There are two different styles for schedules:

subclause2.para: the first style uses numbered paragraphs with titles after each number (like this schedule - use this wherever possible, as it is more robust when outputting to Word;

para.emphasis: It is very important that these two styles are not mixed in the same schedule, as this causes the numbering in the Word version to corrupt.

clause.para: Each type of standard document is designed to allow different combinations of sections to be used. The following sections can be used in a formal agreement:

entry.para: Sections youcan use, but don't have to use
Coversheet, Table of contents, Operative, Signature
Introductory wording ("This agreement is dated [DATE]"), Parties clause, Background (recitals), Testimonium, Schedule(s), Annex

clause.title: The signature is not appearing.
clause.para: Check that the parties clause and its attributes are set up correctly. Attributes are needed for the execution method (choose from contract or deed) and status of the party (for example, individual or company).

clause.title: The word "agreement" is missing from "this agreement is dated [DATE]".
clause.para: This means that a precedent type code has not been added. Add a precedent type code in PLC Files. Do this by dragging the title of the standard document onto the relevant precedent type folder on the topic tree.

clause.title: The testimonium is missing.
